summary.p: Asks Bullinger to assist his son-in-law [Johann] Walder, who is demanding the payment of a life annuity promised upon leaving the monastery from the Zurich council; also wrote to [Hans] Rudolf Lavater about it. Was very pleased when he learned from [Georg Müller] about Lavater's election to the council. Müller will report further news. Hopes for good correspondence with Lavater.

div.p: The grace of God first and my willing service.

Honorable, well-learned, dear Master Heinrich, I have written to you on behalf of my son-in-law Walder, as you know, that he was in the monastery in Zurich, and like others, he has not yet received anything, but he has always been promised, as I also hope he has done, that if he conducts himself honorably and well, he will be rewarded; however, he has not yet received a definitive answer. Now my lords have again sent a recommendation to a council in Zurich, hoping for a better response than before. I have also written to my dear lord and friend, Herr Rudolf Lavater. I ask you to help with him to do the best, so that a good answer may result. I believe that I would well deserve it for a city like Zurich and its people.

Dear sir, I have just learned from my old lord of Wettingen that the aforementioned Lavater has been elected to the council; this has greatly delighted me, not only because I wish him well in honor, but also because I hope to God that he will achieve much good in God's and temporal matters in the council, and that I and other good friends will have a trusted man to write to from time to time about what necessity and other matters of God and otherwise require. I hereby wish him a long life, support, and increase of divine grace, so that he may faithfully apply the same talent to our Lord. Amen.
As for other news and how things stand with us, I think the aforementioned my lord of Wettingen will report the same to you well.
We want to encourage the much-mentioned Lavater to write often; I will do so as well. And hereby we commend ourselves to God the Lord.
Given in Basel, the 18th of June, in the year 1536.
To the honorable and well-learned Master Heinrich Bullinger, servant of the word of the church in Zurich, my dear and good friend.
